cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 385 miles SE of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest toward the North and South Carolina coasts, then forecast to slow and drift west-southwest inland across South Carolina and into northern Georgia late this weekend.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the North Carolina/South Carolina border roughly around Wilmington, NC

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: South Santee River SC to Duck NC, including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds; Storm Surge Warning for the same stretch
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coastline from northern Florida through the Carolinas and into Virginia, with greatest effects along the Carolina coast
weather_observation.wind: Up to a 28% chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (34 kt) late Saturday through Sunday; 6% chance of 50-kt winds. Gusty NE–E winds likely to affect cargo handling and vessel movements.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation under 3 ft possible during high tides, but no significant surge threat indicated for the Georgia coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands could bring 3–6 inches of rain with localized totals over 4 inches, creating ponding on terminal surfaces and potential localized flooding of access roads.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough seas along the Georgia shelf waters; possible river flooding upstream later next week.
